storyTitle: As Employee, I want to filter my schedule by shift type to quickly find relevant shifts

testCases.title: Validate filtering by single shift type
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has access to the schedule section
Schedule contains shifts of multiple types (Morning, Afternoon, Night, etc.)
At least one Morning shift exists in the employee's schedule
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section loads successfully displaying all assigned shifts

steps.action: Locate and click on the filter panel or filter icon
steps.expectedResult: Filter panel opens showing available shift type options

steps.action: Select 'Morning' shift type from the available filter options
steps.expectedResult: 'Morning' shift type is highlighted/selected in the filter panel

steps.action: Click 'Apply' or confirm the filter selection
steps.expectedResult: Schedule refreshes and displays only shifts with 'Morning' shift type. All other shift types are hidden from view

steps.action: Verify the filtered results show only Morning shifts
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts are confirmed to be Morning shifts. No Afternoon, Night, or other shift types are visible

steps.action: Click the 'Clear filter' button or option
steps.expectedResult: Filter is removed and schedule refreshes to display all shifts regardless of type

steps.action: Verify all shifts are now visible
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays all shift types (Morning, Afternoon, Night, etc.) that were previously assigned

postconditions: Filter is cleared and no filters are active
Schedule displays all shifts in their original state
System is ready for next filter operation

testCases.title: Validate filtering by multiple shift types
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has access to the schedule section
Schedule contains shifts of multiple types including Morning and Night shifts
At least one Morning shift and one Night shift exist in the employee's schedule
Filter panel supports multi-select functionality
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section loads successfully displaying all assigned shifts

steps.action: Open the filter panel by clicking on the filter icon or button
steps.expectedResult: Filter panel opens showing all available shift type options with multi-select capability

steps.action: Select 'Morning' shift type from the filter options
steps.expectedResult: 'Morning' shift type is highlighted/checked indicating selection

steps.action: Select 'Night' shift type from the filter options while keeping 'Morning' selected
steps.expectedResult: Both 'Morning' and 'Night' shift types are highlighted/checked indicating multiple selections are active

steps.action: Click 'Apply' button to apply the multiple filters
steps.expectedResult: Schedule refreshes and displays only shifts that are either 'Morning' or 'Night' shift types

steps.action: Verify the filtered results contain only Morning and Night shifts
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts are confirmed to be either Morning or Night shifts. No Afternoon or other shift types are visible in the schedule

steps.action: Scroll through the filtered schedule to confirm consistency
steps.expectedResult: All visible shifts throughout the schedule are either Morning or Night type with no exceptions

postconditions: Schedule displays only Morning and Night shifts
Filter remains active showing selected shift types
Other shift types remain hidden until filter is cleared

testCases.title: Verify filter performance under 2 seconds
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has access to the schedule section
Large dataset of schedule shifts is available (minimum 500+ shifts across multiple months)
Performance monitoring tool or browser developer tools are available to measure response time
Network connectivity is stable with normal bandwidth
System is under normal load conditions

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section containing the large dataset
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section loads displaying the large dataset of shifts

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor API calls
steps.expectedResult: Network monitoring is active and ready to capture API response times

steps.action: Open the filter panel
steps.expectedResult: Filter panel opens showing available shift type options

steps.action: Note the current timestamp or start the performance timer
steps.expectedResult: Timer is ready to measure the filter operation duration

steps.action: Select a shift type filter (e.g., 'Morning') and click Apply
steps.expectedResult: Filter request is sent to the server and processing begins

steps.action: Monitor the API call to GET /api/schedules?shiftType={type} in the Network tab
steps.expectedResult: API request is visible in Network tab with response time metrics

steps.action: Measure the total time from clicking Apply until filtered results are fully displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Filtered results are displayed and total response time is recorded

steps.action: Verify the measured response time is under 2 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Total time from filter application to results display is less than 2 seconds (meeting the performance requirement)

steps.action: Repeat the test with different shift type filters to ensure consistent performance
steps.expectedResult: All filter operations complete within 2 seconds regardless of shift type selected

postconditions: Filter performance meets the 2-second requirement
Filtered results are accurately displayed
System performance metrics are documented
Schedule remains functional after performance test

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to search my schedule by date to quickly locate specific shifts

testCases.title: Validate search by single date
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has access to the schedule section
Schedule contains shifts across multiple dates
At least one shift exists on the target search date
Search panel is accessible from the schedule view
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section loads successfully displaying all assigned shifts across various dates

steps.action: Locate and click on the search panel or search icon
steps.expectedResult: Search panel opens displaying date input field(s) and calendar picker option

steps.action: Click on the date input field to activate the calendar picker
steps.expectedResult: Calendar picker interface opens showing current month and selectable dates

steps.action: Select a valid date (e.g., '2024-03-15') from the calendar picker that has scheduled shifts
steps.expectedResult: Selected date appears in the date input field in the correct format

steps.action: Click 'Search' or 'Submit' button to execute the search
steps.expectedResult: Search request is processed and schedule view refreshes

steps.action: Verify the displayed schedule shows only shifts for the selected date
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays only shifts scheduled for the searched date (2024-03-15). No shifts from other dates are visible

steps.action: Check that all displayed shifts match the searched date
steps.expectedResult: All visible shift entries show the date '2024-03-15' confirming accurate search results

steps.action: Verify the shift count matches expected number for that date
steps.expectedResult: Number of displayed shifts corresponds to the actual shifts scheduled for that specific date

postconditions: Schedule displays only shifts for the searched date
Search criteria remains active in the search panel
Other dates' shifts are hidden from view
Search can be cleared to restore full schedule view

testCases.title: Validate search by date range
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has access to the schedule section
Schedule contains shifts across multiple dates
Shifts exist within the target date range to be searched
Search panel supports date range input (start date and end date)
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section loads successfully displaying all assigned shifts

steps.action: Open the search panel by clicking the search icon or button
steps.expectedResult: Search panel opens showing separate input fields for start date and end date with calendar picker options

steps.action: Click on the 'Start Date' input field
steps.expectedResult: Calendar picker opens for start date selection

steps.action: Select a valid start date (e.g., '2024-03-01') from the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Start date '2024-03-01' appears in the start date input field

steps.action: Click on the 'End Date' input field
steps.expectedResult: Calendar picker opens for end date selection

steps.action: Select a valid end date (e.g., '2024-03-15') that is after the start date
steps.expectedResult: End date '2024-03-15' appears in the end date input field

steps.action: Verify both start and end dates are correctly displayed in the search panel
steps.expectedResult: Search panel shows Start Date: 2024-03-01 and End Date: 2024-03-15

steps.action: Click 'Search' or 'Submit' button to execute the date range search
steps.expectedResult: Search request is processed and schedule view refreshes with filtered results

steps.action: Verify the schedule displays only shifts within the specified date range
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays all shifts with dates between 2024-03-01 and 2024-03-15 (inclusive). No shifts outside this range are visible

steps.action: Scroll through the results and verify date boundaries
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts have dates >= 2024-03-01 and <= 2024-03-15. No shifts from February or after March 15 are shown

steps.action: Verify the total count of shifts matches expected shifts within the date range
steps.expectedResult: Number of displayed shifts corresponds to all shifts scheduled between the start and end dates

postconditions: Schedule displays only shifts within the specified date range
Search criteria (start and end dates) remain visible in search panel
Shifts outside the date range are hidden
Search can be modified or cleared as needed

testCases.title: Verify error handling for invalid date input
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has access to the schedule section
Search panel is accessible and functional
System has validation rules for date format
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section loads successfully displaying all assigned shifts

steps.action: Open the search panel by clicking the search icon or button
steps.expectedResult: Search panel opens with date input field(s) ready for input

steps.action: Click on the date input field to enable manual text entry (bypass calendar picker if possible)
steps.expectedResult: Date input field is active and accepts keyboard input

steps.action: Enter an invalid date format such as '32/13/2024' (invalid day and month)
steps.expectedResult: Invalid date text appears in the input field

steps.action: Click 'Search' or 'Submit' button to attempt the search
steps.expectedResult: System validates the input and detects the invalid date format

steps.action: Verify that an error message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Clear error message appears stating 'Invalid date format. Please enter a valid date.' or similar user-friendly message

steps.action: Verify that the search operation is blocked
steps.expectedResult: Search is not executed. Schedule view remains unchanged showing all shifts

steps.action: Test with another invalid format such as 'abc123' (non-date characters)
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed again and search is blocked

steps.action: Test with invalid date value like '2024-02-30' (February 30th does not exist)
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed indicating invalid date value and search is blocked

steps.action: Clear the invalid input and enter a valid date format
steps.expectedResult: Error message disappears and valid date is accepted in the input field

steps.action: Verify that search can now proceed with valid date
steps.expectedResult: Search button is enabled and search executes successfully with valid date input

postconditions: Invalid date inputs are rejected with appropriate error messages
Schedule view is not affected by invalid search attempts
System validation is functioning correctly
User can correct the input and proceed with valid search
